file_content.text: You see anything suspicious, let me know. Someone's got to keep an eye on the Gormak.
The Gormak artillery's destroyed. The Shrine of Healing is safe.
Thought my hair would go gray waiting. Do you know how many people would have died if they'd hit the shrine?
The Voss commandos sent a squad to investigate the commotion. Came back shocked. Said "thanks," I think.
If the Voss are in danger, it's my duty to protect them.
No thanks necessary.
Maybe you could knock some sense into the rest of the order.
The Voss have a language all their own.
It's their way.
Just part of the local color. It's worth protecting along with the rest.
Hope they remember when it's time to make an alliance.
Long as they're safe.
Maybe we're the ones who should remember. You saw what they're up against at that dam.
Sending creds is traditional in my circles.
A reward always helps.
I suppose I've got a little something. Didn't realize you were a mercenary.
Maybe the Voss will take you more seriously next time.
You've earned their trust.
Let's hope so. I guarantee the Gormak will try this again.
They can deal with the Gormak themselves next time.
Last time I help them.
We can't let our guard down now. Plenty of other targets. The Voss might have their visions, but we have good eyes.
I'll need more scouts. We'll create a perimeter around the shrine. The Gormak won't shed a scale without us knowing.
You're willing to go far to protect the Voss.
That's dedication.
That's what I signed on for. We're still the Republic, aren't we?
We've still got the Empire to worry about.
Don't go overboard.
Better start worrying. That artillery was advanced. The Gormak aren't primitives.
I better leave now.
You saved a lot of lives today. Might never hear it from the Voss, but thanks.
What are you still doing here? Destroy that artillery before it destroys the shrine!
Wait! You're no Republic army, but you're close enough. I need every man I can get.
Master Jedi! I know the order's not keen on the Voss, but this is an emergency.
Major! Been calling the Republic for hours. Guess the fifty-second time's the charm.
You! If you know how to use that weapon you're carrying, you've just been drafted.
Beryl, Republic scout. Voss dam nearby's been overrun with Gormak. They've set up artillery all over the perimeter.
Voss think they're defending the dam, but that artillery's in position to hit the Shrine of Healing. We have to stop them!
Have the Voss or the Republic tried to retake the dam?
I'm here to help.
Voss don't believe the artillery's a threat. Republic won't lift a finger without permission.
If this is a true threat, the Voss must be warned.
Alert the Voss first.
You know how they are with outsiders. Told me to mind my business and leave.
Keep talking like that and you'll start a panic.
Calm down and be quiet.
Good. The Empire's not the only threat around here, you know.
The Voss seem pretty calm about their impending doom.
Nobody else looks worried.
Occupied dam's no threat when the Gormak are firing on shuttles and terrorizing pilgrims.
What's the Shrine of Healing?
Remind me about the Shrine.
Big cloister for the Mystics? Most sacred building on Voss? Try looking up once in a while.
There's plenty of Voss commandos around. Ask them for help.
Let the Voss stop them.
The commandos are the only reason the Gormak aren't crushing our skulls underfoot right now.
I've seen how these savages work. They'll keep pounding the shrine until there's nothing left.
Dead Mystics, fleeing pilgrims, fire, rubble, Gormak everywhere. You think the Voss will want to talk alliance after that?
The only thing that matters is saving Voss lives.
I'll help them either way.
Glad you've got your priorities straight. Certain other nameless officers don't.
The Voss may see this as outsider meddling.
They may refuse anyway.
They can boot me offworld for all I care. We can't let the shrine get destroyed!
We need the Voss on our side, whatever it takes.
The alliance is important.
Not letting their most sacred landmark get destroyed should win us a few points.
Don't sugarcoat this for me or anything.
Thanks for the mental image.
None of us have the stomach for what it would really look like. Trust me.
We have to act.
If the Voss don't move on this, that's their mistake.
It's not our problem.
Gonna be everyone's mistake when the Gormak reach Voss-Ka, board our ships and start pillaging the Outer Rim.
There are access tunnels near the shrine that lead to the dam. Place is crawling with Gormak, but the artillery's exposed.
Destroy that artillery, and the commandos can clear out any Gormak left. Well? What are you waiting for?
The Gormak won't get to fire a single shot.
I'm going.
I'll breathe once that artillery's destroyed. Get going!
Send word to the shrine. The Voss may need to evacuate.
Keep trying the Voss.
I'll drag them out by the ears if I have to. Hurry!
Let the brass know we made the call to move in.
Notify the Republic.
Anyone objects, they'll get an earful from me. Good luck.
You were on a roll there. Seemed rude to interrupt.
The end of your rant.
I'm done. Off with you!
No time to lose.
Move fast. Gormak might see you coming and fire anyway.
If the Voss won't take action, neither will I.
Not my job. [Refuse quest]
If we don't act, the shrine will be destroyed! Blast it, haven't you been listening?
Keep your wits about you. These Gormak savages are everywhere.
